clinical_study.brief_title: Procalcitonin Reveals Early Dehiscence in Pancreatic Surgery: the PREDIPS Study
clinical_study.official_title: Procalcitonin Reveals Early Dehiscence in Pancreatic Surgery: the PREDIPS Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Background. Pancreatic cancer surgery is associated with very high risk of postoperative morbidity and mortality. Anastomotic leak (AL) is one of the worst complications associated with relevant short and long-term sequelae. Procalcitonin (PCT) is a biomarker used to monitor bacterial infections and guide antibiotic therapy and has been shown to have better predictive value of AL after colorectal surgery than C-reactive protein (CRP) and white blood cell count (WBC).
Purpose. The investigators designed a monocentric pilot study to test if PCT might be a sensitive and reliable marker of AL after pancreatic surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of PCT and CRP for anastomotic leak (AL) after pancreatic surgery
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity: % of patients corrected identified by the biomarkers having AL; PCT: procalcitonin, CRP: C-reactive protein, AL: anastomic leak

primary_outcome.measure: Specificity of PCT and CRP for anastomotic leak (AL) after pancreatic surgery
primary_outcome.description: Specificity: % of pts corrected identified by the biomarkers not having AL; PCT: procalcitonin, CRP: C-reactive protein, AL: anastomic leak

secondary_outcome.measure: PCT and CRP cuts-off in 3rd POD with a good NPV for AL
secondary_outcome.description: PCT: procalcitonin, CRP: C-reactive protein, NPV: negative predictive value

secondary_outcome.measure: PCT and CRP cuts-off in 5th POD with a good NPV for AL
secondary_outcome.description: PCT: procalcitonin, CRP: C-reactive protein, NPV: negative predictive value

arm_group.description: all pts operated of pancreatic resection for cancer in the involved units

intervention.description: measuring CRP and PCT in 3rd and 5th POD after pancreatic cancer resection

study_pop.textblock: all pts undergoing pacreatic resections for cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoing all different kinds of pancreatic surgery
- in elective setting
- for cancer
- with a pancreatic anastomosis performed.
Exclusion Criteria:
- age < 18 years
- pregnant women
- patients undergoing pancreatic surgery for benign disease, other kinds of pancreatic surgery without an anastomosis being performed
